programme.title: Women's Qualification & Final | Trampoline Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This event took place on 02/08/2024 at the Bercy Arena, Paris. Bryony Page (GBR) claimed Gold, Viyaleta Bardzilouskaya (AIN) took Silver and Sophiane Methot (CAN) completed the podium.

programme.title: BRA-USA - Women's Gold Medal Match | Football | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Woman's Gold Medal Match took place at Parc des Princes, Paris, on 10/08/2024. The United States of America won the Gold with a victory over Brazil. Final score USA 1:0 BRA.

programme.title: Women's Uneven Bars | Artistic Gymnastics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Artistic Gymnastics session took place at the Bercy Arena, France, on 04/08/2024. Kaylia Nemour (ALG) won the Gold medal, Qiu Qiyuan (CHN) achieved the Silver and Sunisa Lee (USA) claimed the Bronze.

programme.title: Triumph and Tragedy | 72 - A Gathering of Champions
programme.desc: In an emotional journey with his son and grandson, Finland’s Lasse Virén revisits the spot where he rose to his feet after a dramatic fall to win gold. The next day, the spirit of Munich was shattered when a terror attack at the Olympic Village took the lives of 11 Israeli athletes and coaches – a day of tragedy as told by an Israeli survivor, Shaul Ladany, and the gold medallists from around the world who bore witness.

programme.title: Women's 50m Freestyle - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 50m Freestyle was held at Paris La Defense Arena, on 04/08/2024. Sarah Sjoestroem (SWE) claimed Gold with a time of 23.71, Meg Harris (AUS) took Silver and Yufei Zhang (CHN) completed the podium.

programme.title: Sydney's Olympic legacy through the eyes of Aaron Royle and Loudy Wiggins
programme.desc: Sixteen years on, we discover Aaron Royle's Olympic moment that inspired his own journey, and trace the birth of Australia's diving stars.

programme.title: Women's Synchronised 10m Platform | Diving | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Synchronised 10m Platform Diving took place at the Aquatics Centre in France on the 31/07/24. Yuxi Chen/Hongchan Quan (CHN) won the Gold Medal, Jin Mi Jo/Mi Rae Kim (PRK) won the Silver Medal, and Andrea Spendolini/Lois Toulson (GBR) won the Bronze Medal.

programme.title: Anatomy of a diver and a gymnast
programme.desc: The first-ever male Jamaican Olympic Diver and a World Champion Italian Gymnast are physically analysed in a lab.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Diver: Is Yona Knight-Wisdom's physique perfectly balanced?
programme.desc: Jamaica's first-ever male Olympic diver is physically analysed in a lab with some remarkable results.

programme.title: Manuel: the next big thing in Angola’s favorite sport | Playing Fields
programme.desc: A young basketball player from Angola shows us what the sport means to him and dreams of the endelless posibilities the future holds.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Basketball Player: The Incredible Stamina of Laetitia Guapo
programme.desc: We took French 3x3 basketball player Laetitia Guapo and examined her unique physical characteristics in a sports science lab to find out the what it takes to be FIBA's world number 1 ranked female basketball player. With the help of Olympian Lolo Jones, each episode of our sports science original series Anatomy of studies the powers and physiques of an elite athlete to find out what makes them special in their sport.

programme.title: BEL-AUS - Women's Bronze Medal Game | Basketball | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: This Women's Bronze Medal Game took place at the Bercy Arena, France, on 11/08/2024. Australia won Bronze with a final score AUS 85:81 BEL.

programme.title: Can NBA and Dream Team star Laettner teach this team to win?
programme.desc: Team USA and NBA legend Christian Laettner shows the Garinger High School varsity basketball team how they can improve their game.

programme.title: The story of the basketball legend who never gave up on her Olympic dream
programme.desc: In “The Queen”, Brazilian legend Hortencia Marcari explains why she came out of retirement only months after giving birth.

programme.title: Norwegian duo are targeting back-to-back Olympic Gold | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Reigning World and Olympic Champions Christian Sørum and Anders Mol are dominating beach volleyball. Their partnership, rooted in a Viking mentality, has kept them atop the sport for six years. They are now preparing for a historic back-to-back Olympic gold at Paris 2024 to honour Christian's mother's legacy.

programme.title: Women's Discus Throw Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Discus Throw Final took place on 05/08/2024 at Stade de France. Valarie ALLMAN (USA) won the Gold medal, FENG Bin (CHN) won the Silver medal and Sandra ELKASEVIC (CRO) won the Bronze.

programme.title: The Distance | Five Rings Films
programme.desc: The story of an enduring Japanese marathon tradition and a humble champion named Naoko Takahashi who captured her nation’s imagination with a run for the ages at the 2000 Olympic Games.

programme.title: Ethiopia’s Derartu Tulu I Legends Live On
programme.desc: A look at the Olympic achievements of the first black African female gold medallist Derartu Tulu, who is now leading Ethiopia’s national athletics team.

programme.title: Women's 100m Breaststroke - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 100m Breaststroke was held on 29/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Tatjana Smith (RSA) claimed Gold with a time of 1:05.28, Qianting Tang (CHN) took Silver and Mona McSharry (IRL) completed the podium.

programme.title: Women's 200m Freestyle - Final | Swimming | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's 200m Freestyle was held on 29/07/2024 at Paris La Defense Arena. Mollie O'Callaghan (AUS) claimed Gold with a new Olympic Record time of 1:53.27, Ariarne Titmus (AUS) took Silver and Siobhan Bernadette Haughey (HKG) completed the podium.

programme.title: Where are they now? Ian Thorpe’s legend lives on
programme.desc: Thorpe reached the pinnacle of his sport by winning five gold medals, but after retiring he had to find inner peace to succeed again

programme.title: Identify
programme.desc: The inspiring journey of five transgender athletes and how sport helped them find their true identity.

programme.title: Women's Final | Cycling BMX Racing | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
The Cycling BMX Racing Women's Finals took place on 02/08/2024 at Saint-Quentin-en-Yvelines BMX Stadium.
Saya Sakakibara (AUS) won Gold, Manon Veenstra (NED) won Silver and Zoe Classens (SUI) won Bronze.

programme.title: From The Top Episode 2: Charlotte Worthington and The Vamps
programme.desc: Olympic BMX champion Charlotte Worthington meets one of her favourite bands, The Vamps. After attending their concert and hanging our backstage, she invites them for some action at the BMX park. Will they be up for the challenge?

programme.title: Women's Kayak (K1) Semi-Final & Final | Canoe Slalom | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Kayak (K1) Semifinal and Final took place at Nautical St - White Water, on 28/07/24. The Australian Jessica Fox won the Gold with a time of 96.08 seconds. Klaudia Zwolinska (POL) won the Silver, and Kimberley Woods (GBR) won the Bronze Medal.

programme.title: The enduring family legacy of Olympic canoe legend Matija Ljubek
programme.desc: The sprint canoeist Matija Ljubek won four medals at four Olympic Games for Yugoslavia and became a national hero in the process. He passed on his love for the sport to his son Nikica, who became an Olympian himself.

programme.title: The Olympics On The Record | Episode 8
programme.desc: Olympic twins, the greatest gold medalist in gymnastics, the undefeated Kiwis, ice skating innovation and an unlikely Luxembourg gold.

programme.title: Women's Trap Finals | Shooting | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Trap Finals took place on 31/07/2024 at Chateauroux Shooting Centre. Adriana Ruano (GUA) won Gold, Silvana Stanco (ITA) won Silver, and Penny Smith (AUS) won Bronze.

programme.title: Heroes of The Future 2 | Episode 4
programme.desc: In this episode: Belgian fencer Jolien Corteyn, British taekwondo fighter Aaliyah Powell, and German artistic gymnast Daniel Schwed.

programme.title: Women's Omnium, Women's Sprint, Men's Keirin | Cycling Track | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc:
This session includes the Women's Omnium, the Women's Sprint and the Men's Keirin which took place at the Saint-Quentin-En-Yvelines Velodrome on 11/08/24.
The Men's Keirin was won by Harrie Lavreysen (NED) with Gold, Matthew Richardson (AUS) with Silver and Matthew Glaetzer (AUS) with Bronze.
The Women's Sprint was won by Ellesse Andrews (NZL) with Gold, Lea Friedrich (GER) with Silver and Emma Finucane (GBR) with Bronze.
The Women's Omnium was won by Jennifer Valente (USA) with Gold, Daria Pikulik (POL) with Silver and Ally Wollaston (NZL) with Bronze.

programme.title: Can Russia’s rhythmic gymnast Margarita Mamun transform this Z Team?
programme.desc: Olympic gold medalist Margarita Mamun tries to turn around the fortunes of Moscow’s Pirouette Gymnastics team. Is one week enough?

programme.title: Meet the entourage of Miles Chamley-Watson, Jaime Espinal and Devin Logan
programme.desc: Miles Chamley-Watson (USA) x Tattoo artist; Jaime Espinal (PUR) x Mentor; Devin Logan (USA) x Ski Technician

programme.title: Women's Hammer Throw Final | Athletics | Olympic Games Paris 2024
programme.desc: The Women's Hammer Throw Final took place at the Stade de France, France, on 06/08/24. Camryn Rogers (CAN) won the Gold with a distance of 76.97m. Annette Nneka Echikunwoke (USA) won the Silver, and Jie Zhao (CHN), completed the podium,

programme.title: Norwegian duo are targeting back-to-back Olympic Gold | Athletes to Watch
programme.desc: Reigning World and Olympic Champions Christian Sørum and Anders Mol are dominating beach volleyball. Their partnership, rooted in a Viking mentality, has kept them atop the sport for six years. They are now preparing for a historic back-to-back Olympic gold at Paris 2024 to honour Christian's mother's legacy.

programme.title: Meet Gallaudet the only deaf college men’s basketball team in America
programme.desc: Gallaudet Basketball is the only deaf college basketball team in the US. We follow the Bison as they are leading up to a pivotal game on their Senior Night. Through teamwork they come together as one and share an incredible connection.

programme.title: Meet Aaron Wheelz Fotheringham the godfather of extreme wheelchair sports
programme.desc: Aaron uses a custom wheelchair for death-defying stunts. He is now inspiring a new generation of WCMX riders.

programme.title: Meet Ibrahim Hamadtou the Paralympian who plays table tennis with his mouth
programme.desc: Ibrahim lost both arms in a train accident when he was 10 years old. He was introduced to the world as one of the most inspiring athletes from the Rio 2016 Paralympic Games. He now has his sights on Tokyo 2020.

programme.title: Meet Flo Meiler the 85-year-old grandma breaking world records
programme.desc: Flo started to pole vault at 65. Every day she proves that age is no barrier. She is one of the most decorated senior athletes ever. We follow her as she is getting ready to shatter and set more world records at the National Senior Games.

programme.title: Rise of Women Olympians
programme.desc: The Olympic Series Vol.5, Program 1 : The story of Women at the Games, Rise of Women Olympians.

programme.title: Opening Ceremony - Ceremony | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: The Opening Ceremony of the Tokyo 2020 Summer Olympic Games took place on 23/07/2021 at the Olympic Stadium, Tokyo.

programme.title: Women's -49kg & Men's -58kg R16/Quarter-Finals/Semi-Finals - Taekwondo | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 24/07/2021 at the Makuhari Messe Hall A, Tokyo. It includes the Women's -49 kg and the Men's -58 kg Round of 16, Quarterfinals and Semifinals.

programme.title: Women's -49kg & Men's -58kg Repechages/Finals - Taekwondo | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 24/07/2021 at the Makuhari Messe Hall A, Tokyo. It includes the Women's -49 kg and the Men's -58 kg Repechages and Finals as well as their Victory Ceremonies. Wongpattanakit (THA) claimed the Gold in the Women's -49kg and Dell'Aquilla (ITA) in the Men's -58kg.

programme.title: Meet Gallaudet the only deaf college men’s basketball team in America
programme.desc: Gallaudet Basketball is the only deaf college basketball team in the US. We follow the Bison as they are leading up to a pivotal game on their Senior Night. Through teamwork they come together as one and share an incredible connection.

programme.title: Meet Ibrahim Hamadtou the Paralympian who plays table tennis with his mouth
programme.desc: Ibrahim lost both arms in a train accident when he was 10 years old. He was introduced to the world as one of the most inspiring athletes from the Rio 2016 Paralympic Games. He now has his sights on Tokyo 2020.

programme.title: Meet Flo Meiler the 85-year-old grandma breaking world records
programme.desc: Flo started to pole vault at 65. Every day she proves that age is no barrier. She is one of the most decorated senior athletes ever. We follow her as she is getting ready to shatter and set more world records at the National Senior Games.

programme.title: Blue/Finals Piste: Women's Epee Individual & Men's Sabre Individual - Fencing | Tokyo 2020 Replays
programme.desc: This event took place on 24/07/2021 at the Makuhari Messe Hall B, Chiba. It includes the Women's Epée Individual and the Men's Sabre Individual Finals as well as their Victory Ceremonies. Sun Yiwen (CHN) claimed the Gold in the Women's Epee with Ana Maria Popescu (ROU) and Katrina Lehis (EST) completed the podium.
